sections.content:
**Harness your Speech** 🎤

"How to Begin Speaking More Clearly"

***Summary:***
> - Speaking more clearly will help you in day-to-day life as well as interacting with clients
> - Remember to breathe: Not breathing will prevent oxygen from getting to your brain
> - Speak slowly: don’t let nervousness and excitement make you talk quickly

***Action steps:***
> - Remind yourself to breathe when talking
> - Remind yourself to speak slowly when talking

***Summary:***
> - Get so annoyed at yourself that you force yourself to change
> - You stutter more when you forget to breathe
> - Read aloud every day and record yourself trying different accents and volumes to self-identify any issues

***Action steps:***
> - Remind yourself to breathe when talking
> - Record yourself reading aloud for 5 minutes every day

•


**Harness your Speech** 🗣️ 

"Daily exercises to speak better"

***Summary:***
> - Stay hydrated with 3-5L every day - “A hydrated mind is a powerful mind”
> - Focus on your breathing - breathe through the nose and out of your mouth
> - Reading aloud
> - Speak louder in your day-to-day life

***Action steps:***
> - Drink 3-5L of water today
> - Practice breathing through your nose and out through your mouth
> - Read aloud for 5 minutes today
> - Speak louder in your everyday life

•


**Harness your Speech** 🎤

Module 2 - "How to Stay Calm and Not Be Reactive"

***Summary:***
> - Everybody was at one point in their life in reactive mode
> - When something happens, think about it, then respond instead of simply reacting on instinct immediately
> - “Life doesn’t dictate you, you dictate life”

***Action steps:***
> - Think before you respond

•


**Harness your Speech** 👨🏽 

"How to Stop Forgetting What You Are Saying Mid-Sentence"

***Summary:***
> - It’s a sign that your brain isn’t getting enough oxygen
> - Keep talking then ask them a question - as they’re responding, breathe and collect yourself
> - You can also just change the subject

***Action steps:***
> - Breathe properly when you’re talking to someone
> - Ask a question

•


**Harness your Speech** 👨🏽‍🚀 

"How to Have a Deeper Voice"

***Summary:***
> - Understand your tonality which you have control over
> - As long as you’re projecting your voice by speaking from your diaphragm, not your chest
> - Speak a bit louder - you have to get noticed in today’s world

***Action steps:***
> - Speak from your diaphragm
> - Stop being timid
> - Speak a little louder than you’re used to

•


**Harness your Speech** 🎤

Module 3 - "How to Speak to Important People"

***Summary:***
> - Shut up, especially if they’re more successful than you
> - Don’t talk about yourself on and on
> - If they ask you, you can talk about what you’re working on but be concise

***Action steps:***
> - Don't speak
> - Be concise when talking about yourself

•


**Harness your Speech** 👨🏽‍🍳 

"How to Speak in Front of People Easily"

***Summary:***
> - Focus on your breathing
> - Give yourself talking points - bullet points, not paragraphs
> - Learn your topic well so you can freestyle

***Action steps:***
> - Learn your topic well
> - Create bullet points for what you’re speaking on
> - Breathe deeply

***Appendix:*** If you would like more in-depth videos on harnessing your speech, public speaking, networking and social skills, proceed to the Main Campus. <#1131412120781717645>

||**“No one likes feeling stupider than the next person. The trick, then, is to make your victims feel smart—and not just smart, but smarter than you are. Once convinced of this, they will never suspect that you may have ulterior motives.”**||
•




> **Congratulations, you completed** <#1081741146885201960>.
> 
> 
> On to the next channel <#1087615795443548201>.
